trans-unit.source: Used to specify which configuration file is to be represented by the Configuration object.

Use <xref:System.Configuration.ConfigurationUserLevel> to specify which configuration file is to be represented by the Configuration object returned by <xref:System.Configuration.ConfigurationManager.OpenExeConfiguration%2A?displayProperty=fullName> and <xref:System.Web.Configuration.WebConfigurationManager.OpenMachineConfiguration%2A?displayProperty=fullName>.
Application configuration files are in the same directory as the application and have the same name, but with a .config extension.
For example, the configuration file for C:\System\Public.exe is C:\System\Public.exe.config.
Applications use a global configuration that applies to all users, separate configurations that apply to individual users, and configurations that apply to roaming users.
Get the <xref href="System.Configuration.Configuration"></xref> that applies to all users.
Get the roaming <xref href="System.Configuration.Configuration"></xref> that applies to the current user.
Get the local <xref href="System.Configuration.Configuration"></xref> that applies to the current user.
